benchmark_details.name: Synthetic Persona Dataset
benchmark_details.overview: The Synthetic Persona Dataset is introduced to systematically investigate cross-modal factual memorization in vision-language models by creating diverse synthetic personas, complete with visual representations and textual descriptions, aimed at quantifying knowledge transfer between modalities.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To quantify cross-modal memorization in vision-language models by analyzing how knowledge is transferred between modalities, specifically from images to text and vice versa.

data.source: Synthetic persona dataset generated using text-to-image models and narrative description models.
data.size: 100 unique personas with multiple image and description variants
data.annotation: Automatically generated descriptions conditioned on visual attributes.

methodology.calculation: Measured performance based on model's ability to recall names and attributes from images and descriptions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better cross-modal memorization and knowledge transfer.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Synthetic data is used to mitigate privacy risks inherent in real data collection.
